info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.cloud_link
info.description:
CloudLink is used to establish private connectivity from customer network to Cloud Sites or private connectivity from
F5 XC Regional Edge(RE) to customer Cloud Sites

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name

x-example: "aws-cloud-link-east"
Name of Cloud Link.

post.description: Creates a new CloudLink with configured parameters

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: metadata.namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "staging"
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

put.description: Replaces configured CloudLink with new set of parameters

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: metadata.namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "staging"
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

parameters.name: metadata.name
parameters.description:
name

x-example: "acmecorp-web"
The configuration object to be replaced will be looked up by name

namespace

name

The name of the configuration object to be fetched

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description:
The format in which the configuration object is to be fetched. This could be for example
    - in GetSpec form for the contents of object
    - in CreateRequest form to create a new similar object
    - to ReplaceRequest form to replace changeable values

Default format of returned resource
Response should be in CreateRequest format
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
Response should have other objects referring to this object
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object

cloud_linkAWSBYOCListType.description: List of Bring You Own Connection
cloud_linkAWSBYOCListType.title: Bring You Own Connection List

connections.description:
List of Bring You Own Connections. These AWS Direct Connect connections are not managed by F5XC but will be used for connecting sites and REs.

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 10
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.min_items: 1
connections.title: List of Bring You Own Connections

cloud_linkAWSBYOCType.description: AWS Bring You Own Connection. F5XC supports Virtual interfaces from the same AWS cloud account.
cloud_linkAWSBYOCType.title: Bring You Own Connection

bgp_asn.description:
The Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number (ASN) of your on-premises
 router for the new virtual interface to be configured on AWS.

Example: ` "64512"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 2147483647
bgp_asn.title: BGP ASN

connection_id.description:
Id of the existing AWS Direct Connect Connection

Example: ` "dxcon-a2h48678"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.pattern: ^(dxcon-)([a-z0-9]{8}|[a-z0-9]{17})$
connection_id.title: Direct Connect Connection Id

region.description:
Region where the connection is setup

Example: ` "us-east-1"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"ap-northeast-1\",\"ap-southeast-1\",\"eu-central-1\",\"eu-west-1\",\"eu-west-3\",\"sa-east-1\",\"us-east-1\",\"us-east-2\",\"us-west-2\",\"ca-central-1\",\"af-south-1\",\"ap-east-1\",\"ap-south-1\",\"ap-northeast-2\",\"ap-southeast-2\",\"eu-south-1\",\"eu-north-1\",\"eu-west-2\",\"me-south-1\",\"us-west-1\",\"ap-southeast-3\"]
region.title: Region

tags.description:
AWS Tags is a label consisting of a user-defined key and value.
 It helps to manage, identify, organize, search for, and filter resources in AWS console.
 Specified tags will be added to Virtual interface along with any F5XC specific tags

Example: ` "devstaging"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 128
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.max_pairs: 40
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.min_len: 1
tags.title: AWS Tags

user_assigned_name.description:
Exclusive with [system_generated_name]
 User is managing the AWS resource name

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
user_assigned_name.title: User Assigned

vlan.description:
Virtual Local Area Network number for the new virtual interface to be configured on the AWS.
 This tag is required for any traffic traversing the AWS Direct Connect connection

Example: ` "700"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 4094
vlan.title: Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN)

AWS F5 XC Managed CloudLink Connection
cloud_linkAWSF5XCManagedType.title: F5 XC Managed CloudLink Connection

cloud_linkAWSStatusType.title: Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Link Status
cloud_linkAWSStatusType.x-displayname: Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Link Status

connection_status.description: Status reported by Amazon Web Services (AWS) CloudLink Connection
connection_status.title: CloudLink Direct Connect Connection Status

error_description.description:
Description of error on site

Example: ` "value"`
error_description.title: Error Description

suggested_action.description:
Suggested action for customer on error

Example: ` "value"`
suggested_action.title: Suggested Action

custom_asn.description:
Exclusive with []
 F5XC will use custom ASN to create a Direct Connect Gateway

Example: ` "64512"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.ranges: 64512-65534, 4200000000-4294967294
custom_asn.title: Custom ASN

cloud_linkAzureStatusType.title: Azure Cloud Link Status

x-displayName: "Azure Cloud Provider"
CloudLink for Azure Cloud Provider
cloud_linkAzureType.title: Azure Cloud Provider

address_family.description:
The address family setup for the BGP peer.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"ipv4\",\"ipv6\"]
address_family.title: Address Family

asn.description: The autonomous system number (ASN) for the cloud provider side of the connection
asn.title: Cloud Provider ASN

bgp_peer_id.description: The ID of the BGP peer
bgp_peer_id.title: BGP Peer IP

bgp_peer_state.description:
The state of the BGP peer.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"verifying\",\"pending\",\"available\",\"deleting\",\"deleted\"]

The status of the BGP peer.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"up\",\"down\",\"unknown\"]
bgp_status.title: BGP Peer Status

cloud_provider_address.description: The BGP peer IP configured on the cloud provider endpoint
cloud_provider_address.title: Cloud Provider Router Peer IP

customer_address.description: The BGP peer IP configured on the Customer endpoint
customer_address.title: Customer Peer IP

cloud_linkCloudLinkDeploymentStatus.description:
Status of the CloudLink deployment

 - IN_PROGRESS: In-Progress

CloudLink provisioning is in-progress
 - ERROR: Error

An error occurred while deploying CloudLink. Check the error description and suggested action
 - READY: Ready

CloudLink is ready for use
 - DELETING: Deleting

CloudLink deleting in progress
 - CUSTOMER_DEPLOYED: Customer Deployed

Customer deploys the CloudLink
 - NOT_APPLICABLE: NotApplicable

Deployment status not applicable
cloud_linkCloudLinkDeploymentStatus.title: CloudLink Status

cloud_linkDeleteRequest.title: DeleteRequest is used to delete a cloud_link

region.description: Region where the connection is located
region.title: Region

 It helps to manage, identify, organize, search for, and filter resources in AWS console.

cloud_linkGCPBYOCListType.description: List of GCP Bring You Own Connections
cloud_linkGCPBYOCListType.title: GCP Bring You Own Connection List

connections.description:
Each 'Bring Your Own Connection' represents a virtual connection that the customer has provisioned in the Cloud (example: AWS Direct Connect). F5XC will orchestrate networking resources in the cloud to facilitate seamless private connectivity. 

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 10
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.min_items: 1
connections.title: List of Bring You Own Connections

interconnect_attachment_name.description:
Name of already-existing GCP Cloud Interconnect Attachment

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 63
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1
interconnect_attachment_name.title: Interconnect Attachment Name

project.description:
Exclusive with [same_as_credential]
 Specify a GCP Project for the interconnect attachment

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 30
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 4
project.title: Project ID

region.description:
GCP Region in which the GCP Cloud Interconnect attachment is configured

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"asia-east1\",\"asia-east2\",\"asia-northeast1\",\"asia-northeast2\",\"asia-northeast3\",\"asia-southeast1\",\"asia-southeast2\",\"europe-central2\",\"europe-north1\",\"europe-west1\",\"europe-west2\",\"europe-west3\",\"europe-west4\",\"europe-west6\",\"europe-west8\",\"europe-west9\",\"europe-west10\",\"europe-west12\",\"europe-southwest1\",\"me-west1\",\"me-central1\",\"me-central2\",\"northamerica-northeast1\",\"northamerica-northeast2\",\"us-central1\",\"us-east1\",\"us-east4\",\"us-east5\",\"us-south1\",\"us-west1\",\"us-west2\",\"us-west3\",\"us-west4\",\"southamerica-east1\",\"southamerica-west1\",\"australia-southeast1\",\"australia-southeast2\",\"asia-south1\",\"asia-south2\"]
region.title: Region

cloud_linkGetResponseFormatCode.description:
x-displayName: "Get Response Format"
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the GetResponse

 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_DEFAULT: x-displayName: "Default Format"
Default format of returned resource
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_CREATE: x-displayName: "Create request Format"
Response should be in CreateRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_REPLACE: x-displayName: "Replace request format"
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_STATUS: x-displayName: "Status format"
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_READ: x-displayName: "GetSpecType format"
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_REFERRING_OBJECTS: x-displayName: "Referring Objects"
Response should have other objects referring to this object
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_BROKEN_REFERENCES: x-displayName: "Broken Referred Objects"
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object
cloud_linkGetResponseFormatCode.title: GetResponseFormatCode

tags.description:
AWS Tags is a label consisting of a user-defined key and value which are assocaited with this coonnection.
 It helps to manage, identify, organize, search for, and filter resources in AWS console.

Example: ` "devstaging"`
tags.title: AWS Tags

virtual_interface_state.description:
The state of the virtual interface

Type of the virtual interface

vlan.description:
Virtual Local Area Network number for the new virtual interface to be configured on the AWS.

Example: ` "700"`
vlan.title: Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN)

cloud_linkVirtualInterfaceType.description:
Defines the type of virtual interface that needs to be configured on AWS

 - PRIVATE: Private

A private virtual interface should be used to access an Amazon VPC using private IP addresses.
 - TRANSIT: Transit

A transit virtual interface is a VLAN that transports traffic from a Direct Connect gateway to one or more transit gateways.
cloud_linkVirtualInterfaceType.title: Virtual Interface Type

ioschemaEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
ioschemaEmpty.title: Empty

ioschemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
ioschemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) uid.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.description: BlindfoldSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by F5XC Secret Management
schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.title: BlindfoldSecretInfoType

decryption_provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Secret Management service.

Example: ` "value"`
decryption_provider.title: Decryption Provider

location.description:
Location is the uri_ref. It could be in url format for string:///
 Or it could be a path if the store provider is an http/https location

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
location.title: Location

store_provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "value"`
store_provider.title: Store Provider

schemaClearSecretInfoType.description: ClearSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret that is not encrypted.
schemaClearSecretInfoType.title: ClearSecretInfoType

provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "box-provider"`
provider.title: Provider

url.description:
URL of the secret. Currently supported URL schemes is string:///.
 For string:/// scheme, Secret needs to be encoded Base64 format.
 When asked for this secret, caller will get Secret bytes after Base64 decoding.

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
url.title: URL

schemaCloudLinkState.description:
State of the CloudLink connections

 - UP: Up

CloudLink and their corresponding Direct Connect connections are up and healthy
 - DOWN: Down

CloudLink and their corresponding Direct Connect connections are down
 - DEGRADED: Degraded

Some of Direct Connect connections with the CloudLink are down
 - NOT_APPLICABLE: NotApplicable

CloudLinkState not applicable
schemaCloudLinkState.title: CloudLink State

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status
hostname.title: hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated
last_update_time.title: last_update_time

reason.description:
x-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
 A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status
service_name.title: service name

status.description:
Status of the condition
 "Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
 "Failed"  Validation has failed.
 "Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
 "Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
 "Down" Configuration is operationally down. e.g. down interface
 "Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. ObjectMetaType.Disable = true.
 "NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs

Example: ` "Failed"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Success\",\"Failed\",\"Incomplete\",\"Installed\",\"Down\",\"Disabled\",\"NotApplicable\"]
status.title: status

type.description:
Type of the condition
 "Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
 "Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object

Example: ` "Operational"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Validation\",\"Operational\"]
type.title: type

schemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

 - EOK: No error
 - EPERMS: Permissions error
 - EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
 - ENOTFOUND: Not found
 - EEXISTS: Already exists
 - EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
 - ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
 - EINTERNAL: Server error
 - EPARTIAL: Partial error
schemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description:
A human readable string of the error

Example: ` "value"`
message.title: message

schemaInitializerType.description: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.
schemaInitializerType.title: InitializerType

name.description: name of the service that is responsible for initializing this object.
name.title: name

schemaInitializersType.description: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization of a configuration object
schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.
pending.title: pending

schemaMessageMetaType.description:
MessageMetaType is metadata (common attributes) of a message that only certain messages
have. This information is propagated to the metadata of a child object that gets created
from the containing message during view processing.
The information in this type can be specified by user during create and replace APIs.
schemaMessageMetaType.title: MessageMetaType

SecretEncodingType defines the encoding type of the secret before handled by the Secret Management Service.

 - EncodingNone: x-displayName: "None"
No Encoding
 - EncodingBase64: Base64

x-displayName: "Base64"
Base64 encoding
schemaSecretEncodingType.title: SecretEncodingType

schemaSecretType.title: SecretType

schemaStatusMetaType.description: StatusMetaType is metadata that all status must have.
schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
 for latest status object from same origin
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
 This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.

Example: ` "ver.re1.int.ves.io"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
 identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
 information

Example: ` "ver-instance-1"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

status_id.description:
status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
 objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
 daemon(creator-id)
status_id.title: status_id

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

 - STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
 - STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.description:
SystemObjectGetMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.title: SystemObjectGetMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaVaultSecretInfoType.description:
x-displayName: "Vault Secret"
VaultSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by Hashicorp Vault.
schemaVaultSecretInfoType.title: VaultSecretInfoType

key.description:
x-displayName: "Key"
x-example: "key_pem"
Key of the individual secret. Vault Secrets are stored as key-value pair.
If user is only interested in one value from the map, this field should be set to the corresponding key.
If not provided entire secret will be returned.
key.title: Key

location.description:
x-displayName: "Location"
x-required
x-example: "v1/data/vhost_key"
Path to secret in Vault.
location.title: Location

provider.description:
x-displayName: "Provider"
x-required
x-example: "vault-vh-provider"
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Vault.
provider.title: Provider

version.description:
x-displayName: "Version"
x-example: "1"
Version of the secret to be fetched. As vault secrets are versioned, user can specify this field to fetch specific version.
If not provided latest version will be returned.
version.title: Version

cloudlink_network_name.description:
Establish private connectivity with the F5 Distributed Cloud Global Network using a Private ADN network. To provision a Private ADN network, please contact F5 Distributed Cloud support.

Example: ` "private-cloud-ntw"`

Required: YES
